wikipedia_page.main:
John George Alexander Baird (1854–1917) was Unionist MP for Glasgow Central.
Baird was educated at Eton and Christ Church, Oxford.
He first stood for the seat in 1885, won it in 1886, but lost it narrowly in 1906.
Baird served as a lieutenant of the 16th Lancers. He was later Lieutenant-colonel of the Ayrshire (Earl of Carrick's Own) Imperial Yeomanry.

response: *John George Alexander Baird (1854–1917), Member of Parliament for Glasgow Central

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1886 United Kingdom general election
List of MPs elected in the 1900 United Kingdom general election

response: At the next general election, in January 1906 he chose to contest a seat in his native Scotland and was elected as the MP for Glasgow Central (UK Parliament constituency), defeating the sitting Conservative MP John George Alexander Baird by a margin of 3.4%.

The pall bearers at Baird's funeral included seven cousins, one of whom was John George Alexander Baird, the member of parliament for Central Glasgow. Charlie Mitchell attended the funeral but did not join the procession.
